item.title: Plotting Word Bigrams with 3 Chinese Classics
item.description: In the last post, we saw frequencies of the most common words in the Analects, Zhuangzi, and Mozi texts. The faceted plot did an excellent job of capturing a generic “idea” of each text. However, I wondered how the results might change when plotting bigrams (2 word combinations of adjacent words) as opposed to single values. This is where I ran into a problem with Tidytext – although it worked fine for tokenizing Chinese text into single character tokens, it did not perform as well at separating the text into bigrams.
